alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 8:46PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS NEAR ASH FORK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas near Ash Fork down to the Summerland Ranch area. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms had ended. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ash Fork Draw, Partridge Creek, Johnson Creek, Martin Dam Draw, Eightmile Creek and Pineveta Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ash Fork. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 139 and 151. Business Interstate 40 near mile marker 146. State Route 89 between mile markers 362 and 363. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious of the dangers of flood waters at night. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
